subject: Real Estate
title: Global Capital Flows into Property
description: One-minute skill: Global Capital Flows into Property.

hook.text: Every year, over $300 billion in cross-border capital flows into real estate worldwide.

buildup.text: Investors from Asia, the Middle East, and Europe compete for trophy buildings in London, New York, and Tokyo.

discovery.text: Property is attractive because it's tangible, generates income, and can't be moved to another country.

twist.text: But foreign capital often inflates local prices, making housing unaffordable for the people who live there.

climax.text: The tension between global investment and local affordability is the defining property conflict of the century.

quiz.question: Why does cross-border capital flow into real estate?
